pullRequest.title: Move `rawType` to `TypeToken`
pullRequest.bodyText:
Move the rawType to TypeToken level instead of only inside ClassToken so that ArrayToken will also be able to get its raw type, which enables us to decode arrays of object.
Geting Class<?> type from GenericArrayType is not straightforward and hard, we will not support GenericArrayType for now.

nodes.bodyText: pls make it final and set through the private constructor.
I don't think you need super here or anywhere above and below.

I've read a bit more on generic arrays and it looks like they are even more weird than I'd thought, i.e. there is not even a "sane" way to create one - it just won't compile - even though the type Optional<String>[] itself is legal in java.
So I would suggest you remove the todo and just leave it as explicitly not supported.
Also consider using the error message rtdb uses 
  
    
      firebase-android-sdk/firebase-database/src/main/java/com/google/firebase/database/core/utilities/encoding/CustomClassMapper.java
    
    
         Line 200
      in
      a7096ac
    
    
    
    

        
          
           "Generic Arrays are not supported, please use Lists " + "instead");
I think you also need to update equals and hashCode now that it has a rawType.
nodes.diffHunk:

   public static class ArrayToken<T> extends TypeToken<T> {

nodes.bodyText: super() have to be the first statement in a constructor
